title: Agua de Jamaica
description: Agua de Jamaica is a refreshing hibiscus tea commonly enjoyed in Mexico.
author: J.J Franklin

title: Chiles en Nogada
description: Chiles en Nogada is a traditional Mexican dish featuring poblano chiles filled with picadillo and topped with walnut sauce and pomegranate seeds.
author: Maria Sanchez

title: Tacos al Pastor
description: Tacos al Pastor are tacos filled with marinated pork cooked on a vertical spit, similar to shawarma.
author: Juan Martinez

title: Mole Poblano
description: Mole Poblano is a rich sauce made with chocolate and spices, often served over chicken or turkey.
author: Ana Ramirez

title: Guacamole
description: Guacamole is a dip made from mashed avocado mixed with lime juice, onions, tomatoes, and cilantro.
author: Carlos Lopez

title: Cochinita Pibil
description: Cochinita Pibil is slow-roasted pork marinated in achiote paste and sour orange juice, often served in tacos.
author: Elena Torres

title: Tamales
description: Tamales are steamed corn dough filled with various meats, cheese, or vegetables, wrapped in corn husks.
author: Rosa Hernandez

title: Pozole
description: Pozole is a hearty soup made from hominy corn with meat (usually pork), seasoned with chilies and served with various toppings.
author: Miguel Gonzales

title: Tostadas
description: Tostadas are crispy fried or toasted tortillas topped with various ingredients like beans, meat, and vegetables.
author: Isabella Martinez

title: Ceviche
description: Ceviche is a seafood dish typically made from fresh raw fish cured in citrus juices, mixed with onions, tomatoes, and cilantro.
author: Diego Ramirez

title: Churros
description: Churros are fried dough pastries, often coated in cinnamon sugar, and served with chocolate or caramel sauce.
author: Luis Hernandez
